item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, April 17, 2025 at 6:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Zoom outage caused by accidental 'shutting down' of the zoom.us domain (287 points | 144 comments)
2. Kennedy promises to find environmental causes of autism (21 points | 9 comments)
3. Darwin's children drew all over the “On the Origin of Species” manuscript (2014) (382 points | 106 comments)
4. Jellyfin as a Spotify alternative (262 points | 222 comments)
5. OpenAI Codex CLI: Lightweight coding agent that runs in your terminal (397 points | 213 comments)
6. Show HN: Plandex v2 – open source AI coding agent for large projects and tasks (116 points | 26 comments)
7. Concurrency in Haskell: Fast, Simple, Correct (63 points | 26 comments)
8. 12-factor Agents: Patterns of reliable LLM applications (313 points | 47 comments)
9. TLS certificate lifetimes will officially reduce to 47 days (422 points | 541 comments)
10. Demolishing the Fry's Electronics in Burbank (116 points | 74 comments)
11. Damn Vulnerable MCP Server (176 points | 53 comments)
12. "Vivarium": The keeper of a lab's animals stumbles onto a secret [fiction] (39 points | 7 comments)
13. Man who built ISP instead of paying Comcast expands to hundreds of homes (2022) (406 points | 176 comments)
14. Query Engines: Push vs. Pull (2021) (66 points | discuss)
15. How a Forgotten Battle Created a More Peaceful World (88 points | 28 comments)
16. Unix files have (at least) two sizes (54 points | 20 comments)
17. How refrigeration changed our food (9 points | 3 comments)
18. eInk Mode: Making web pages easier to read (117 points | 41 comments)
19. How Nintendo bled Atari games to death (190 points | 134 comments)
20. US judge finds administration wilfully defied court order in deportation flights (96 points | 43 comments)
21. CVE Foundation (345 points | 66 comments)
22. Kermit: A typeface for kids (301 points | 146 comments)
23. In Two Moves, AlphaGo and Lee Sedol Redefined the Future (2016) (11 points | 2 comments)
24. OneSignal (YC S11) Is Hiring Engineers ( | hide)
25. OpenAI o3 and o4-mini (483 points | 437 comments)
26. Reproducing Hacker News writing style fingerprinting (258 points | 124 comments)
27. Breaking the Llama Community License (125 points | 67 comments)
28. GPT o3 frequently fabricates actions, then elaborately justifies these actions (9 points | 2 comments)
29. Nix Trigonometric Math Library from Ground Zero (32 points | 2 comments)
30. A high-throughput parser for the Zig programming language (116 points | 10 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, April 17, 2025 at 6:25 AM UTC
